articles.headline: On Roads Turned Waterways, Volunteers Improvise to Save the Trapped and Desperate
articles.snippet: Alongside a massive local, state and federal disaster response was an equally massive volunteer rescue effort that operated with little official guidance.
articles.abstract: Alongside a massive local, state and federal disaster response was an equally massive volunteer rescue effort that operated with little official guidance.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — The men from East Texas had just boarded their boat here, when there was a sudden jarring bump underneath.

articles.headline: It Was an Uneasy Time for Immigrants in Texas. Then the Rains Came.
articles.snippet: State and federal policies hostile to undocumented immigrants have added to the stress of a devastating storm.
articles.abstract: State and federal policies hostile to undocumented immigrants have added to the stress of a devastating storm.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — This has been a harrowing year for the hundreds of thousands of undocumented immigrants who have put down stakes in Houston.
articles.byline: By Simon Romero and Miriam Jordan

articles.headline: Trump Tax Plan May Free Up Corporate Dollars, but Then What?
articles.snippet: Republicans are promising to stimulate investment and create jobs. But steps to undo tax dodges may not produce the intended economic lift.
articles.abstract: Republicans are promising to stimulate investment and create jobs. But steps to undo tax dodges may not produce the intended economic lift.
articles.lead_paragraph: The tax overhaul promised by President Trump and Republican congressional leaders is lugging a remarkably heavy load. The goal is not only to reduce the tax bills of corporations and small businesses, but also to stimulate investment, create jobs, increase global competitiveness and promote economic growth.

articles.headline: Inside Uber’s Wild Ride in a Search of a New C.E.O.
articles.snippet: Before Uber’s board chose Dara Khosrowshahi to be the company’s new chief, there were power plays, negotiations for more leverage and wild swings in support.
articles.abstract: Before Uber’s board chose Dara Khosrowshahi to be the company’s new chief, there were power plays, negotiations for more leverage and wild swings in support.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — By last Friday afternoon, most of Uber’s eight directors had gathered in San Francisco for a board meeting. Their agenda was simple: Pick a new chief executive for the ride-hailing company.

articles.headline: Stalled Over Gulf, Harvey Deepens Texans’ Soggy Misery
articles.snippet: The death toll from Harvey was rising and officials said their rescue effort was nowhere near done.
articles.abstract: The death toll from Harvey was rising and officials said their rescue effort was nowhere near done.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Five days after the pummeling began — a time when big storms have usually blown through, the sun has come out, and evacuees have returned home — Tropical Storm Harvey refused to go away, battering southeast Texas even more on Tuesday, spreading the destruction into Louisiana and shattering records for rainfall and flooding.
articles.byline: By Jack Healy, Richard Pérez-Peña and Alan Blinder

articles.headline: A Scion of Mexico Fights Corruption, and Becomes a Target
articles.snippet: The son of a corporate chairman has been targeted by advanced spying technology bought by the Mexican government to combat terrorism and organized crime.
articles.abstract: The son of a corporate chairman has been targeted by advanced spying technology bought by the Mexican government to combat terrorism and organized crime.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — President Enrique Peña Nieto sat before the nation’s titans of industry and allowed himself a smile.

articles.headline: ‘Cortana, Open Alexa,’ Amazon Says. And Microsoft Agrees.
articles.snippet: In an unusual partnership, Amazon and Microsoft are working together to extend the abilities of their voice-controlled digital assistants.
articles.abstract: In an unusual partnership, Amazon and Microsoft are working together to extend the abilities of their voice-controlled digital assistants.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — The crowded pack of voice-controlled digital assistants — Apple’s Siri, Google Assistant, Amazon’s Alexa and Microsoft’s Cortana — are good at numerous things. They can help people play music, set up calendar appointments and check the weather.

articles.headline: Google Critic Ousted From Think Tank Funded by the Tech Giant
articles.snippet: After the New America Foundation praised a large fine levied on Google, the man behind the statement was fired.
articles.abstract: After the New America Foundation praised a large fine levied on Google, the man behind the statement was fired.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In the hours after European antitrust regulators levied a record $2.7 billion fine against Google in late June, an influential Washington think tank learned what can happen when a wealthy tech giant is criticized.

articles.headline: How ‘Doxxing’ Became a Mainstream Tool in the Culture Wars
articles.snippet: Identifying extremist activists and revealing their personal information has become a bit of a sport on the internet. Some worry about mistakes and the permanent stigma of online shaming.
articles.abstract: Identifying extremist activists and revealing their personal information has become a bit of a sport on the internet. Some worry about mistakes and the permanent stigma of online shaming.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Riding a motorized pony and strumming a cigar box ukulele, Dana Cory led a singalong to the tune of “If you’re happy and you know it clap your hands.”

articles.headline: Trump in Missouri Lays Groundwork for Tax Overhaul but Offers No Details
articles.snippet: In a speech on Wednesday in Springfield, Mo., President Trump laid out the case for cutting taxes for businesses and individuals and for simplifying the tax code.
articles.abstract: In a speech on Wednesday in Springfield, Mo., President Trump laid out the case for cutting taxes for businesses and individuals and for simplifying the tax code.
articles.lead_paragraph: SPRINGFIELD, Mo. — President Trump on Wednesday pitched a sweeping tax overhaul that he said would unleash the American economy and help ordinary people, promising that a large corporate tax cut and trims to individual income tax rates would boost the middle class.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Binyamin Appelbaum

articles.headline: U.S. Economy Grew 3% in 2nd Quarter, Fastest Pace in 2 Years
articles.snippet: The Commerce Department’s revised estimate of the annual growth rate is below President Trump’s 4 percent target, but better than the first-quarter pace.
articles.abstract: The Commerce Department’s revised estimate of the annual growth rate is below President Trump’s 4 percent target, but better than the first-quarter pace.
articles.lead_paragraph: The current recovery has entered its ninth year — long by economic standards — but it is showing some unexpected vigor.
